com.pump.image.gif.block

Class GifImageDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifBlock
      • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifGraphicRenderingBlock
        • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifImageDescriptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GifConstants

    public class GifImageDescriptor
extends GifGraphicRenderingBlock
    There must be GifImageDescriptor for each GifImageDataBlock. This block will precede the image data, but there may be a local color table immediately following this block.

    The GIF file format specification describes this block as follows:

    "Each image in the Data Stream is composed of an Image Descriptor, an optional Local Color Table, and the image data. Each image must fit within the boundaries of the Logical Screen, as defined in the Logical Screen Descriptor.

    The Image Descriptor contains the parameters necessary to process a table based image. The coordinates given in this block refer to coordinates within the Logical Screen, and are given in pixels. This block is a Graphic-Rendering Block, optionally preceded by one or more Control blocks such as the Graphic Control Extension, and may be optionally followed by a Local Color Table; the Image Descriptor is always followed by the image data.

    This block is REQUIRED for an image. Exactly one Image Descriptor must be present per image in the Data Stream. An unlimited number of images may be present per Data Stream."

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Description copied from class: GifBlock
        This outputs the exact byte representation of this block.

        A series of these byte arrays combined can create a GIF file.

        Specified by:

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns:
        the left x-coordinate of this image

        The GIF file format specification verbosely explains this as follows:

        "Column number, in pixels, of the left edge of the image, with respect to the left edge of the Logical Screen. Leftmost column of the Logical Screen is 0."

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns:
        the upper y-coordinate of this image

        The GIF file format specification verbosely explains this as follows:

        "Row number, in pixels, of the top edge of the image with respect to the top edge of the Logical Screen. Top row of the Logical Screen is 0."

      • hasLocalColorTable

        public boolean hasLocalColorTable()
        Returns:
        true if this block is followed by a GifLocalColorTable.

      • isInterlaced

        public boolean isInterlaced()
        Returns:
        true if the image is interlaced. An image is interlaced in a four-pass interlace pattern, described in Appendix E of the GIF file format specification.

        See GifInterlace.

      • setInterlaced

        public void setInterlaced(boolean b)
        Indicates whether the upcoming image is interlaced.
        Parameters:
        b - whether interlacing is active or not.

      • isLocalColorTableSorted

        public boolean isLocalColorTableSorted()
        Returns:
        true if there is a GifLocalColorTable following this block, and that color table is sorted in order of decreasing importance.

      • setLocalColorTableSorted

        public void setLocalColorTableSorted(boolean b)

      • setLocalColorTableSize

        public void setLocalColorTableSize(int size)
        Assigns the local color table size for this block. If you pass 0 or -1 to this method, this effectively turns off the local color table.

        If i is 0 or -1, subsequent calls to hasLocalColorTable() will return false.

        Parameters:
        size - must be a power of 2 between 2 and 256, or else -1 or 0 to indicate that there is no local color table.

      • getLocalColorTableSize

        public int getLocalColorTableSize()
        Returns:
        the number of colors in the following GifLocalColorTable.
